io.netty.handler.codec

Class ByteToByteEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelOperationHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelOutboundByteHandlerAdapter
          • io.netty.handler.codec.ByteToByteEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelOperationHandler, ChannelOutboundByteHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SnappyFramedEncoder, ZlibEncoder

    public abstract class ByteToByteEncoder
extends ChannelOutboundByteHandlerAdapter
    ChannelOutboundByteHandlerAdapter which encodes bytes in a stream-like fashion from one ByteBuf to an other. This kind of decoder is often useful for doing on-the-fly processing like i.e. compression. But you can also do other things with it. For example here is an implementation which reads Integers from the input ByteBuf and square them before write them to the output ByteBuf. 
         public class SquareEncoder extends ByteToByteEncoder {
         @Override
         public void encode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, ByteBuf in, ByteBuf out)
                 throws Exception {
             if (in.readableBytes() < 4) {
                 return;
             }
             int value = in.readInt();
             out.writeInt(value * value);
         }
     }

      • encode

        protected abstract void encode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
          ByteBuf in,
          ByteBuf out)
                        throws Exception
        Encodes the from one ByteBuf to an other. This method will be called till either the input ByteBuf has nothing to read anymore or till nothing was read from the input ByteBuf.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ByteToByteDecoder belongs to
        in - the ByteBuf from which to read data
        out - the ByteBuf to which the decoded data will be written
        Throws:
        Exception - is thrown if an error accour
